snippet: A Taliban commander described how police officers helped Taliban fighters, sometimes selling them ammunition, other times tipping them off to impending police operations, a member of Afghanistan’s Parliament said.
abstract: Afghanistan official says captured Taliban commander Mullah Mujahid contends police officers have helped Taliban fighters by selling them ammunition and tipping them off to planned police movements; at least 32 officers are suspected and more than twelve have been arrested in one of most important corruption probes in years.

byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar and Fazal Muzhary contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A Taliban commander described how police officers helped Taliban fighters, sometimes selling them ammunition, other times tipping them off to impending police operations, a member of Afghanistan’s Parliament said.

headline.main: Police Force in Afghanistan Is Studied for Ties to Taliban
headline.print_headline: Police Force Is Studied for Ties to Taliban
